pullRequest.body:
This PR defines the type `Triangulated.Subcategory C` when `C` is a pretriangulated category. It also introduces a type class `CategoryTheory.ClosedUnderIsomorphisms` for a predicate on objects in a category `C`.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
Otherwise, looks great, happy to leave it you if any renaming is warranted.

bors d+

:v: joelriou can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8735572163/job/23968597699)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8735572163/job/23968597186)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8735572163/job/23968597438)
`RespectsIso` is something I would expect to be defined for a predicate `C â Prop`, not for a `Set C`. I think I would expect this to be called `ClosedUnderIsomorphisms` for something like that.
Thanks for the suggestion. I have changed sets into predicates.

Conflating a set with its underlying property is considered defeq abuse, it would be better to write this as
```suggestion
def isoClosure : Set C := { X | â Y â S, Nonempty (X â Y) }
```

You could also consider adding basic API lemmas like
```lean
@[simp]
lemma mem_isoClosure_iff {S : Set C} {X : C} : X â isoClosure S â â Y â S, Nonempty (X â Y) :=
  mem_setOf

lemma mem_isoClosure {S : Set C} {X : C} (h : X â S) {Y : C} (e : X â¶ Y) [IsIso e] :
    Y â isoClosure S :=
  mem_isoClosure_iff.mpr â¨X, h, â¨(asIso e).symmâ©â©
```
I have added these (phrased in terms of predicates). I did not make `mem_isoClosure_iff` a `simp` lemma though.
Since there is no data here, I think it makes sense to phrase `mem_of_iso` and `mem_iff_of_iso` in terms of `IsoIso` rather than `Iso` (or maybe in addition to the existing results).
I have added the `IsIso` variants. (In the applications, I use more `Iso` than `IsIso`.)

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion isoClosure P X â â (Y : C) (_ : P Y), Nonempty (X â Y) := by rfl ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion isoClosure P X â â (Y : C) (_ : P Y), Nonempty (X â Y) := by rfl ```
Should `mem_of_iso` be renamed now that we are talking about predicates rather than sets?
Perhaps even just `of_iso`?

I have renamed `subset_isoClosure` as `le_isoClosure`, etc. The `mem_of_iso` field of `ClosedUnderIsomorphisms` is also renamed `of_iso`. But then, for the API lemmas in the `CategoryTheory` namespace, as it is no longer in a namespace `Set`, I do not see significantly better name to for `CategoryTheory.mem_of_iso` and a few others. (Anyway, if better names are found later, it will be easy to make the change.)

```suggestion
def isoClosure : C â Prop := fun X => â (Y : C) (_ : P Y), Nonempty (X â Y)
```
This is obviously the same, but for me much easier to understand. :-)
